event.title: the future Dakar-Niger Railway, and the French need for trade centers, led

data.event: Its location on the path of the future Dakar-Niger Railway, and the French need for trade centers, led to the creation of the Kayes market town in 1881.

event.title: the creation of the Kayes market town in 1881

data.event: Its location on the path of the future Dakar-Niger Railway, and the French need for trade centers, led to the creation of the Kayes market town in 1881.

event.title: remains a transport hub, primarily for Senegalese trade, to this day

data.event: It remains a transport hub, primarily for Senegalese trade, to this day.

In 1892, Kayes became the capital of the French Sudan; Bamako replaced it as the capital, first of the state of Haut Sénégal-Niger on October 17, 1899, then as the capital of all of French Sudan in 1908.

event.title: replaced it as the capital, first of the state of Haut Sénégal-Niger on October 17, 1899

data.event: In 1892, Kayes became the capital of the French Sudan; Bamako replaced it as the capital, first of the state of Haut Sénégal-Niger on October 17, 1899, then as the capital of all of French Sudan in 1908.
The town has an international airport (Kayes Airport), and lies on the Dakar-Niger Railway which offered regional passenger train service to Bamako three times a week via Kati and Diamou as of 2013.
